div.head: Introduction
div.p: The present ODD specification structly covers the elements described in ISO 24613-4 as the refence TEI serialisation for the LMF multipart standard.

Any further TEI implementaitons that intend to be compliant with ISO 24613-4 can further customize this specification, under the conditions that they remain compliant with the normative constraints expressed in the standard. Still, as stated in ISO 24613-4, they can add further constraints on attribute values for instance or constructions to enhance full text content.
The specification intends to be largely inclusive of existing TEI elements so that only the constraints relevant for the compliance with the LMF standard is ensured.

div.head: Classes from the macro- and meso-structures
Implementation of the various LMF classes
div.p: The classes defined in LMF-1 are the following ones:

cit.quote: The classes defined in ISO 24613-1, the LMF Core model, that are used in the MRD extension include LexicalResource, GlobalInformation, Lexicon, LexiconInformation, GrammaticalInformation, LexicalEntry, Lemma, Form, Sense, Definition, OrthographicRepresentation, and principles for applying the CrossREF class. These classes, together with the associations and constraints described in ISO 24613-1, are applicable to the design of MRD. New classes introduced in this part include the WordForm, Stem, WordPart, RelatedForm, Translation, Example, FormRepresentation, TextRepresentation, and Bibliography.

div.head: Implementation of the LexicalResource class
div.p: LexicalResource is implemented with the teiCorpus element, with the type attribute set to lexicalResource
div.note: The present specification forces lexicalResource as the mandatory unique value for type on teiCorpus.
div.p: A LexicalResource is seen a the grouping of several different lexical lexica, which corresponds exactly with the intended usage of teiCorpus.

div.head: Implementation of the Lexicon class
div.p: Lexicon is implemented with the TEI element, with the type attribute set to lexicon
div.note: The present specification forces lexicon as the mandatory unique value for type on TEI.
